ygData.subject: RE: a slight correction
ygData.msgSnippet: Gnomes Start at Skill level 50. They can only gain Skill ONCE they hit 16 & not before. I said that any race other than Gnome can NOT gain any Tinkering skill
ygData.messageBody:
Gnomes Start at Skill level 50. They can only gain Skill ONCE they hit 16 &
not before. I said that any race other than Gnome can NOT gain any Tinkering
skill even though we all have the Basics in the skill. I have had a GM
Confirm this for me. Sorry if this Makes you mad or what ever, but it is the
Truth. We have 50 skill, but CAN NOT gain any more than what we start with,
where as a Gnome, once they reach level 16 can then Train beyond that level
50 in skill. If you look at a Gnome before level 16, tinkering does not show
up in their Personal Skills list if I am not mistaken. But once they hit
that level 16 it becomes available to them.

-----Original Message-----
From: Big Dave [mailto:xceller@...]
Sent: Monday, October 25, 1999 6:05 PM
To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] a slight correction

From: "Big Dave" <xceller@...>

But, by your own statement, you don't have the skill. If it isn't there,
you don't have it. AND you can't learn it. Languages you don't have yet
aren't there, but when you learn them they show up.
the only thing I can think of that takes no skill to make is the firewater,
although the compasses and flameless lanterns are pretty low. Oh, and you
can probably make the animated bait, maybe the fishing poles, not sure.

As far as you saying you have the base 50 skill, is there some way you can
show that or demonstrate it? Everything I have read and learned about
tinkering says that only gnomes have the base 50 skill, and then only once
they reach level 16.


-----Original Message-----
From: Battlestaff Fuzzietoe <andrie@...>
To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, October 25, 1999 10:41 AM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] a slight correction


>From: "Battlestaff Fuzzietoe" <andrie@...>
>
>I have made stuff that takes a 50 skill or less in tinkering to make, but
>was unable to make any thing above the 50 skill mark, such as Flameless
>Lanterns. Which on the 10 I tried told me every time I lack the skill. It
>does not show up in our Skill list that we have tinkering, but it is there.
>Just like languages that we do not know. They do not show up, but that does
>not mean we can not learn them. Tinkering does not show up on my skill
list,
>but I still have the Base 50.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Big Dave [mailto:xceller@...]
>Sent: Monday, October 25, 1999 2:22 PM
>To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] a slight correction
>
>From: "Big Dave" <xceller@...>
>
>No other race or class has any tinkering skill at all that I have seen or
>heard of. I have 5 other characters and none of them have a skill in
>tinkering...halfling, dark elf, high elf, dwarf, and a human. Only my
gnome
>has a box marked tinkering. And it started at skill 50 when I hit 16. Not
>only that, but I could not put any guild-training points into it either.
>
>However, anyone can go get a tinkering toolbox and try to tinker something.
>The fishing poles are pretty low level, as are the firewater, compasses,
and
>flameless lanterns.
>Anything higher than that and you are going to fail miserably.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Battlestaff Fuzzietoe <andrie@...>
>To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
>Date: Monday, October 25, 1999 8:36 AM
>Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Do you have to be a gnome to do tinkering??
>
>
>>From: "Battlestaff Fuzzietoe" <andrie@...>
>>
>>Well Every Char & Race has a Base of 50 Tinkering. We will fail More than
>>the Gnomes on Trivial Items, but we can still tinker basic stuff. The
only
>>Draw back is our Skill WILL NEVER INCREASE, since Gnomes MUST train in
this
>>at their Guild to activate the skill. I made a Collapsible Fishing poll
>>yesterday with my 34th level Halfling Druid :). Well Good Luck
>>

>>From: ms277017@... [mailto:ms277017@...]

>>Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Do you have to be a gnome to do tinkering??
>>

>so
>>I dunno =(
>>
